Heboh Desa Fiktif, Mantan Mendes PDTT : Modus Lama
07 Nov 2019, 15:44 by Marga Rahayu


Heboh Desa Fiktif, Mantan Mendes PDTT : Modus Lama

KBRN, Jakarta : Menteri Desa Pembangunan Daerah Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi di Era Jokowi-JK Eko Putro Sandjojo menyatakan penyelewengan dana desa dengan modus desa fiktif sulit dilakukan karena akan diawasi oleh banyak pihak.
Tidak hanya itu, Eko mengatakan penyaluran dana desa yang dimulai sejak tahun 2015 mengharuskan Kepala Desa dan perangkatnya melengkapi syarat pencairan yang diakui Eko tidak sedikit, yakni harus menyerahkan rencana penggunaan anggaran desa. Selain itu, pencairan yang terbagi dalam tiga tahap tersebut turut mensyaratkan aparat desa memberikan laporan hasil pemanfaatan anggaran mereka untuk mencairkan dana desa tahap berikutnya.
Terkait kemunculan Desa Siluman seperti terjadi di Konawe Sulawesi Tenggara Eko Putro Sandjojo mengatakan fenomena tersebut merupakan modus lama yang pernah terjadi di era kepemimpinannya selama 2016-2019.
“Kasusnya ada di Jambi misalnya tapi sudah Saya turunkan satgas dan sudah clear”, ujar Eko kepada Radio Republik Indonesia, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Namun kata Eko, fenomena ini sangatlah kasuistis sehingga bila terindikasi sebagai penyelewengan dana Negara maka Eko menyarankan oknum tersebut segera diproses secara hukum.
 “Ini kasus yang spesifik ya dan saya rasa bukan sistemik. Kalau memang kasus criminal ya wajib diproses dibawa ke meja hijau dan pelakunya dihukum seberat mungkin untuk memberikan efek jera kepada yang lain. Tapi desa siluman itu susah ya karena yang mengawasi banyak, ada satgas, kepolisian, dan kejaksaan dan Pemerintah”, kata Eko.
Diketahui sejak 2015, Pemerintah telah menggulirkan triliunan rupiah dana Negara untuk program Dana Desa. Hingga kini 74.954 desa telah menikmati dana desa dengan besaran yang berbeda berkisar antara 700 juta rupiah hingga 4 miliar rupiah.
Sebelumnya Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani menyatakan dari hasil evaluasi penyaluran dana desa  terdapat empat desa di Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara yang diketahui tidak berpenduduk namun menerima dana desa. Atas temuan ini Kementerian Keuangan bersama Kementerian Dalam Negeri dan Kementerian Desa berkomitmen mengusut oknum yang diduga menyelewengkan dana desa.

Splashy Fictitious Village, Former Mendes PDTT: Old Mode
Nov 7 2019, 15:44 by Marga Rahayu


Splashy Fictitious Village, Former Mendes PDTT: Old Mode

KBRN, Jakarta: Minister of the Village Development of Disadvantaged Regions and Transmigration in the Jokowi-JK Era Eko Putro Sandjojo stated that misappropriation of village funds in a fictitious village mode is difficult because it will be overseen by many parties.
Not only that, Eko said the distribution of village funds that began in 2015 requires that the Village Head and his apparatus complete the disbursement requirements recognized by Eko is not small, namely must submit a plan to use the village budget. In addition, the disbursement divided into three stages also required village officials to report on the results of their budget utilization to disburse the next stage of village funds.
Related to the emergence of Siluman Village as happened in Southeast Sulawesi Konawe Eko Putro Sandjojo said the phenomenon was an old mode that had occurred in the era of his leadership during 2016-2019.
"The case is in Jambi, for example, but I have sent down a task force and it has been clear," Eko said to Radio Republik Indonesia, Thursday (11/07/2019).
However, Eko said, this phenomenon is very casuistic, so if it is indicated as a misappropriation of state funds, Eko suggests that the person be immediately legally processed.
"This is a specific case and I don't think it's systemic. If it is indeed a criminal case it must be brought to justice and the perpetrators punished as hard as possible to give a deterrent effect to others. But the stealth village is difficult, because there are many who oversee, there are task forces, the police, and the prosecutor's office and the government ", said Eko.
Since 2015, the Government has rolled out trillions of rupiah in state funds for the Village Fund program. Until now 74,954 villages have enjoyed village funds with different amounts ranging from 700 million rupiah to 4 billion rupiah.
Earlier the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani stated that from the results of the evaluation of the distribution of village funds there were four villages in Southeast Sulawesi Province that were found to be uninhabited but received village funds. Based on this finding, the Ministry of Finance together with the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Villages are committed to investigating individuals suspected of misappropriating village funds.
